Title: Check Welcome message on Home Page
Expected Result: ""Welcome"" message , should be displayed on the top of the home page.
Preconditions: Task board application to be deployed and working property.
Section Description: This section will hold the test for the Home Page of the application
Steps:
1. Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01
  2. Observe the home page

Title: Check side bar availability on Home Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section will hold the test for the Home Page of the application
Steps:
1. Navigate to the application Home Page
2. Observe the side menu

Title: Check Task Summary Section on Home Page
Expected Result:
The total number of tasks to be 6.
The number of tasks for Done board should be 2.
The number of tasks for in progress board should be 1.
The number of tasks for Open board should be .
Preconditions: The application to be deployed and to have total of 6 tasks(2 in "done", 1 in  "in progress" , 3 in "Open")
Section Description: This section will hold the test for the Home Page of the application
Steps:
1. Navigate to the application.
2. Observe the Task Summary Section.

Title: Check Quick Access Buttons on Home Page
Expected Result: The following buttons should be displayed: Task Board, Create Task, Search Tasks, and RESTful API
Preconditions: Application to be deployed and to have created tasks in the system
Section Description: This section will hold the test for the Home Page of the application
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link:
2.Observe Quick Access buttons

Title: Check Task Board Navigation from Side bar links
Expected Result: user should be navigated to task board page , and the should load correctly.
Preconditions:
Application to be deployed and working.
Home Page to be opened.
Section Description: This section wild hold the tests for task board page
Steps:
1. Click ""Task Board"" link from side menu on home page.
  2. Observe The Task Board page

Title: Check Task Board Page Navigation from quick access buttons
Expected Result:
User to be redirected to task board page.
Task board page loaded correctly.
Preconditions:
Application to be deployed and working.
Home page opened.
Section Description: This section wild hold the tests for task board page
Steps:
1. Click ""Task Board"" quick access button.
2. Observe Task Board Page.

Title: Check task Board Page Boards
Expected Result:
Display tasks organized by boards in a grid layout.
The boards should be ordered as follows: Open, In Progress, Done.
Preconditions: Application to be deployed and working.
Section Description: This section wild hold the tests for task board page
Steps:
1. Open task board  page.
2. Observe boards layout.

Title: Check tasks for valid details in Task Board Page
Expected Result: Each task should include the task title, a brief description, and action options such as ""View"" and ""Edit.""
Preconditions: Applications to be deployed and working.
Section Description: This section wild hold the tests for task board page
Steps:
1. Open task board page.
2. Observe every single task.

Title: Check side bar availability on Task board Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links: Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section wild hold the tests for task board page
Steps:
1. Open task board page.
2. Observe side bar links.

Title: Check Task Creation Page Navigation From side bar link
Expected Result:
User to be redirected to  Create task Page.
Create task page to be loaded correctly.
Preconditions:
Application to be deployed. 
Home page opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Click ""Create"" option from the side menu.
2. Observe task creation page.

Title: Check Task Creation Page Navigation from Quick Action Buttons
Expected Result:
User to be redirected to Task creation Page.
Task creation page to be loaded correctly.
Preconditions:
Application to be deployed. 
Home page opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Click ""New Task"" button located on the Home Page for quick access
2. Observe task creation page.

Title: Check Task Creation form(All  elements should present)
Expected Result:
The following fields should be displayed and interactable.
Title, Description, Board.
Create button should be visible and clickable.
Preconditions:
Application to be deployed. 
Home page opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
Open task Creation page.
Observe task creation form.

Title: Check Task Creation with all fields filled
Expected Result: Task should be created and should be populated in ""In progress"" board.
Preconditions: Task Creation Page to be opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Fill data in Title field(""Test Title"").
2. Fill data in Description field(""Test Description"").
3. Select ""in progress"" for board field.
4. Click ""Create"" button.

Title: Check Task Creation with only required fields filled
Expected Result: Task to be created in ""Done"" board with the correct data.
Preconditions: Task creation page opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Fill data in Title field(""Test title"").
2. Select ""Done"" from board dropdown.
3. Click create button.

Title: Check Task Creation without filling title
Expected Result: Error message should be displayed and task to not be created.
Preconditions: Task creation page to be opened.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Select ""Done"" for board dropdown.
2. Fill data in Description field.
3. Click create button.

Title: Check side bar availability on Task Creation Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links: Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task creation page
Steps:
1. Open task creation page.
2. Observe side bar links.

Title: Check for correct navigation to task view page, when click View button
Expected Result:
User is redirected to task view page.
task view page loaded correctly.
Preconditions: User is navigated to task board page and there should be task created.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task view page
Steps:
1. Click ""View"" button an a task.
2. Observe Task view page.

Title: Check task view page for correct fields and data
Expected Result: Fields for id, title, description, board, dare created, date modified, edit task button should be displayed and the correct data for the corresponding task that was opened.
Preconditions: User is on Task board page and tasks are created.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task view page
Steps:
1. Click ""View"" on task.
2. Observe the task form.

Title: Check side bar availability on Task View Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links: Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task view page
Steps:
1. Open task view page.
2. Observe side bar links.

Title: Check for correct navigation to Edit Task Page when click edit button on task
Expected Result:
User to be redirected to edit task page.
Edit task page is loaded correctly.
Preconditions: User is navigated to task board page and tasks are available
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Click edit button on the task .
2. Observe task edit page.

Title: Check for correct fields on edit task page and correct prefilled data when opened
Expected Result:
The following fields are visible and interactable.
title, description, board.
Edit button is displayed and clickable.
Title, description and board fields have prefilled data.
Preconditions: User is navigated to task board page and tasks are available.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Click edit task button.
2. Observe task edit form and data.

Title: Edit task with by changing only the title
Expected Result: Task title is edited correctly.
Preconditions: User opened a task for edit.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Change the title.
2. Click edit button.

Title: Edit task changing all fields
Expected Result: Title data has been edited, and the task is moved to the new board.
Preconditions: User opened a task for edit.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Change title.
2. Change description.
3. Change board.
4. Click edit button.

Title: Edit task and remove the title
Expected Result: Task is not saved and title is reverted.
Preconditions: User opened task for edit.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Remove the data from the title field.
2. Click edit button

Title: Edit task by removing description
Expected Result: Task is saved without the description.
Preconditions: User opened a task for edit
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. remove description.
2. click edit button.

Title: Check side bar availability on Edit Task Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links: Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for task editing page
Steps:
1. Open task edit page.
2. Observe side bar links.

Application to be deployed.

Expected Result:
User to be redirected to Search task page.
Search task page loaded correctly.

Application to be deployed and working.
Home page opened.

Steps:

Title: Check Search page for correct elements
Expected Result: Keyword field and search button should be displayed.
Preconditions: User is navigated to home page and tasks are available in the system
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Open search task page
2. Observe elements.

Title: Check search with matching result
Expected Result: The matching task should be populated with correct data.
Preconditions: User is navigated to search task page.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Fill keyword for matching task.
2. Click search button.

Title: Check search with no matching result
Expected Result: No tasks are populated and correct message is displayed.
Preconditions: User is navigated to search task page
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Fill keyword field with not matching keyword.
2. Click search button.

Title: Check search with multiple matched results
Expected Result: All matching tasks should be displayed.
Preconditions: User is navigated to search task page.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Fill keyword that matches few tasks.
2. Click search button.

Title: Check search with empty value
Expected Result: no tasks are populated and correct message is displayed.
Preconditions: User is navigated to search task page.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps: 1. Click search button.

Title: Check side bar availability on Search Task Page
Expected Result: Side menu should contain the following links: Home, Task Board, Create, and Search
Preconditions: Application is deployed and working
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Open task search task page.
2. Observe side bar links.

Title: Check for correct total tasks number
Expected Result: The total tasks number should match the actual number of tasks returned by the search.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Click on the Search option from the side menu or quick access buttons.

3.Enter a valid keyword in the search field.

4.Click the Search button.

5.Observe the total tasks number displayed on the search page.

Title: Check for correct message when searching
Expected Result: A message should indicate the number of tasks found or message should  indicate that no tasks were found.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Click on the Search option from the side menu or quick access buttons.

3.Enter a keyword in the search field.

4.Click the Search button.

5.Observe the message displayed on the search page.

Title: Check for new search while user already performed another search
Expected Result:
- the application should allow performing a new search without errors

- search results and total tasks number should update correctly according to the new keyword

- previous search results should be replaced by the new results
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Section Description: This section will hold tests for search task page.
Steps:
1. Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

  2. Click on the Search option from the side menu or quick access buttons.

  3. Enter a first keyword in the search field and click Search.

  4. Observe the search results and any message displayed.

  5. Enter a second, different keyword  in the search field.

  6. Click the Search button again.

  7. Observe the updated search results and message.

Title: Check for correct navigation when click ""Web Api"" quick action button
Expected Result: The application should navigate to the Web API page, displaying all available endpoints for performing CRUD operations on tasks.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for web Api page
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Locate the Quick Access Buttons on the home page.

3.Click on the “Web API” button.

Title: Check for correct data when open  web api page
Expected Result: The Web API page should display all required endpoints (Create, Read, Update, Delete) with correct data format and structure, ready for programmatic interaction.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Section Description: This section will hold the tests for web Api page
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Click on the “Web API” quick access button.

3.Observe the list of available endpoints for CRUD operations on tasks.

4.Verify that each endpoint (Create, Read, Update, Delete) is displayed and accessible.

Title: Check if the side menu displays all required navigation options
Expected Result:
The side menu should display all required navigation options:
Home, Task Board, Create, Search on every page.
Preconditions: Task board application to be deployed and working properly.
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Navigate between the pages Home, Task Board, Create, and Search. and observe the side menu .

Title: Check that the application loads tasks and search results in a timely manner
Expected Result:
1. The Home page and task list should load quickly.

2. Search results should be returned promptly, without noticeable delays.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Steps:
• Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

  • Observe the time it takes for the Home page and task list to load.

  • Navigate to the Search page.

  • Enter a valid keyword in the search field.

  • Observe the time needed for search results to appear.

Title: Check that all task creation and editing actions use secure connections
Expected Result: All data manipulation requests (task creation and editing) should be sent over secure connections.
Preconditions: Task Board application is deployed and working properly.
Steps:
1.Navigate to the application via link: https://replit.com/@kot4eto1/TaskBoardV01

2.Create a new task using the “Create” page.

3.Edit an existing task using the “Task Board” page.

4.Observe the network requests in the browser developer tools.
